subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
In the oracle bone script, it was an {{Han compound|日|頁|ls=ic|t1=sun|t2=head; man|nocap=1}} – man under the scorching sun; summer.

Various variants were seen in the bronze inscriptions from the {{w|Spring and Autumn period}}. {{zh-l|*止|foot}} was often added to the bottom of the man. Additionally, in the form shown above, the {{zh-l|*日}} was removed and {{zh-l|*𦥑|two hands}} was added. The seal script inherits its form from this form, with {{zh-l|*止}} replaced with the related {{zh-l|*夊}}.

Various forms were also seen from the {{w|Warring States period}}. The bamboo and silk script above shows a common form: {{Han compound|日|止|頁}}. The “ancient script” ({{zh-l|*古文}}) from ''{{w|Shuowen}}'' (labelled as the large seal script) has deviated significantly, with {{zh-l|*止}} becoming the related {{zh-l|*足}}. The top part may be a corruption of {{zh-l|*頁}}.

The current form is simplified from the seal script, with the removal of {{zh-l|*𦥑}} and the legs from {{zh-l|*頁}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
; “great; Xia Dynasty; China; Chinese”
: Possibly related to {{och-l|假|great}}, {{och-l|嘏|great}} and {{och-l|廈|big house}} ({{zh-ref|Wang, 1980}}). {{zh-ref|Shi (2000)}} and {{zh-ref|Mair (2013)}} relate this word to {{cog|bo|རྒྱ||great; wide; width; size; expanse; China}}.

; “magnificent colours; variegated”
: The sense “variegated” may be of a different origin. Compare {{cog|sit-pro||*Krā(H)|variegated}} ({{zh-ref|Starostin}}), whence {{cog|bo|བཀྲ||variegated; bright; radiant; splendid}}, {{cog|bo|ཁྲ||many-coloured; variegated; mottled; striped}} and {{cog|my|ကျား||variegated; striped; chequered}}. Possibly related to {{och-l|騢|horse with mixed red and white colour}}.
